metadata.subject: Trump administration appointees' ties to anti-Islam groups

relationships.description: Bolton has appeared frequently on Gaffney's radio show
Bolton is Trump's choice for national security adviser
Gaffney is president and founder of the Center for Security Policy

analysis.purpose: To inform about political connections and ideological ties of Trump administration appointees
analysis.significance: Documents connections between Trump administration officials and anti-Islam advocacy groups

notable_quotes: mosques and Muslims across America are engaged in a 'stealth jihad' to 'Islamize' the country by taking advantage of American pluralism and democracy
Bolton and Pompeo both have ties to individuals and groups promoting a worldview that

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this news excerpt

illegal_activity.description: This is a news article excerpt reporting on political connections and ideological positions, not first-hand illegal activity

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be from mainstream media coverage of Trump administration appointments and their connections to conservative think tanks

analysis.summary: News article excerpt discussing Trump administration appointees John Bolton and Mike Pompeo's ties to Frank Gaffney Jr. and the Center for Security Policy, a think tank that promotes anti-Islam views including the concept of 'stealth jihad' by American Muslims.
